node_revisions_body:
Small full-service marketing communications agency in Addison is seeking a talented Designer/Front-end Web Developer to join its team. You will design Web sites, ad banners, HTML newsletters and depending on experience, print materials, in a fun atmosphere with talented professionals who thrive on teamwork.

We are seeking an energetic candidate with strong design experience who is self-motivated, a team player, problem solver, and can juggle multiple projects in a time-sensitive manner. Looking for career-minded individual who:
- Can translate design files into interactive interfaces with hand-coded, semantic XHTML and CSS, relying on Javascript libraries like jQuery to enhance the user experience
- Experience developing for modern browsers and degrading sites gracefully for older ones
- Adheres to Web standards, best practices, and accessibility and usability guidelines. Possesses proficiency in the Adobe Creative Suite, including Photoshop, Dreamweaver, and Illustrator
- Knowledge in PHP, MySQL, Ajax, content management, CRM, and ecommerce a bonus
- Can build e-mail and landing pages for marketing efforts
- Can improve UI based on source design and technical specs
- Can propose and test improvements for A/B and multi-variate tests
- Is proficient with cross-browser, cross-platform issues, and W3C Web standards
- Has incredible focus and attention to detail, and the ability to meet deadlines in a sometimes-tense environment
- Strong project management skills
- A four-year college degree with at least 2-4 years of front-end Web development experience, preferably within an agency environment
 
This position an onsite position and may be part-time or full-time depending on applicant.
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: E-mail resume, design samples, links to previous work and salary requirements to info@brandnumarketing.com. No agencies and no phone calls please.

node_revisions_body:
It’s a full time/perm position. Salary depends on experience.

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Epsilon - including its Abacus division - is a 21st Century Marketing Services Company that uses consumer and business data together with proven techniques to maximize marketing power for clients worldwide. Services include strategic consulting, database and loyalty technology, proprietary data, predictive modeling and a full range of creative and interactive services including brand and promotional development, web design, email deployment, search engine optimization and direct mail production. Among other notables, Epsilon is the world's largest permission-based email marketer. Epsilon is an Alliance Data company. For more information, visit www.epsilon.com.
 
Job Title: Writer
Do you know Epsilon? Advertising Age, in their Annual Agency Report, ranked Epsilon the #1 Direct Marketing Agency in 2009 – for the second year in a row. And we continue to add Fortune 500 brands to our impressive client roster.
Now we’re looking for a Writer to join our award-winning creative team in Dallas.
 
What you’ll do:
- Collaborate with art directors and develop killer concepts across print and online media: direct mail, email, Web sites and more
- Write consistently compelling copy on everything from simple letter-kits to full-on branding projects
- Join the team and have fun collaborating with people who are passionate about the work they do
 
What you’ll need:
- Experience: 3 years minimum; if you have a little (or a lot) more, we’re still interested
- A portfolio that demonstrates ability to conceptualize and deliver smart, creative ideas in all your work
- An open mind, the ability to work on multiple projects at once, and a willingness to adapt to ever-changing circumstances
 
Interested? Tell us why you’re great.

Belmont Icehouse is looking to fill immediate position for skilled Art Director. Ideal candidate is passionate for print design, but knows their way around Web projects. Candidates must have strong conceptual ability and proven design skills in branding, collateral, direct mail and print advertising. Must have a great attitude, be able to work on multiple projects at a time, have the ability to produce print-ready files, and love Mexican food.

Requirements:
• 2-4 years of experience in agency environment
• CS4 (Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign), QuarkXpress, PowerPoint, Flash and HTML a bonus

Please do not apply if:
• You don’t have a portfolio
• Your portfolio sucks
• You need someone to hold your hand to make deadlines
• You do not have a degree in advertising or graphic design
• You like drama
• You think David Hasselhoff is dreamy

This is a full-time contract to hire position and candidates are required to work onsite.
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: No recruiters, no phone calls. Reply with your resume, salary requirements and portfolio link to jobs@belmonticehouse.com.

node_revisions_body: DFW area branding, design and e-marketing firm with U.S.-wide presence seeks senior level freelance designers for all forms of contract gigs. Strong concept development, proven design skills, file efficiency, and adherence to deadlines/budgets essential. Must have expert level design experience using "the Big 3" (among others)- CS apps PhotoshopIllustrator, InDesign. Innovative design skills should be accompanied by can-do attitude, flexibility in scheduling, proven experience in designing within a client-focsed environment, and project management expertise. Seeking truly top-notch design pros who want challenging, portfolio-enhancing assignments. Aggressive hourly rate based on experience level and availability.
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: Send 3-5 PDF examples of your best work to: webmail@azuremarcom.com.

node_revisions_body: We are looking for someone who is familiar with full website development, modification, and maintanence to coordinate, direct, and integrate the company’s web sites, services, and applications.  To be considered, you must have 3+ years commercial experience in website development with HTML, XML, PHP, PSP, ASP, MS SQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, and MySQL databases as well as IT technical support.  We are looking to hire someone full-time, and are not interested in hiring someone off-site.  Good communication and management skills are necessary for this applicant to interact and collaborate with staff .  We also require the ability to work in an independent role with minimal supervision.
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: If qualified and interested, please email your resume, salary requirements, applicable industry recognized certifications,  links to sites showcasing your work in development, and links to sites that you have developed to mark@faithco.net.

node_revisions_body:
Position Summary
This entry-level position supports the In-House Creative Marketing team and performs edits to graphics, typesetting, layouts; some basic copy writing; and works through art preparation, pre-press, production and post-production logistics.

Principle Duties and Responsibilities
1. Develop and/or edit graphics and layouts for presentations, collateral and advertising.
2. Prepare mockups, assist in photo search, image scanning, collating and development of necessary deliverables.
3. Archive and organize all digital assets.
4. Organize and update image content library.
5. Work closely with Art Director and Marketing Manager to assure completion of deliverables.
6. Assist in coordination of pre-press and printing of materials.
7. Printing marketing collateral and sales presentations on our in-house printers.

Education and Experience
- BFA degree in Graphic Design or equivalent work experience
- 1 year experience or internship experience desired
- Ability to meet deadlines on a daily basis and multitask in a very fast paced corporate environment
- Excellent oral and written communication skills a must given daily interface with multiple internal clients and external contacts
- Ability to work well independently with little direction or as part of a team
- Very strong attention to detail and excellent organizational skills
- Proficiency with Mac OS: Adobe CS (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, Acrobat), PowerPoing and Word
- Flash, SharePoint and/or html background a plus
- Must be comfortable working in a corporate/business professional office
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: Please send resumes to dfwstaffing@plainscapital.com. Online or pdf portfolio/samples required with resume.

node_revisions_body: We’re passionate about what we do. We’re a small ad agency located in the Fair Park area and are currently searching for a permanent part-time Web designer who’s passionate about Flash CS3 Action Scripting, HTML and DreamWeaver.  We can provide the creative direction but we need someone to take charge of our Web projects who works well with our creative team.  Someone who spends their free time discovering new “effects” and truly loves organization and the attention to detail required by the position.  The position includes a guaranteed minimum of 18 hours a week.  Rainmaker is also exploring potential Web contractors as long as they provide competitive rates.
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta:
Do you eat, breathe and sleep Web?  Then send your resume, experience and range of hourly pay to:  ILoveWhatIDo@earthlink.net

node_revisions_body:
This position is primarily responsible for the production of bold, strategic, persuasive messages in all types of media for agency clients. The ideal candidate will have a positive out look and have worked on traditional and on line advertising.

Essential Duties And Responsibilities
- Develops concepts in all media.
- Writes advertising copy from conception to completion in all media, with a heavy emphasis in collateral and print advertising.
- Collaborates with art director partner and team on projects.
- Ability to co-present work internally and to clients.
- Demonstrates exceptional time management skills and meets deadlines.
- Writes in a variety of styles.
- Participates in strategy.
- Remains current on industry trends and technologies.

Qualifications
- Bachelor’s degree in Journalism, Advertising or related field from a four-year college
or university preferred. 
- 3-5 years of advertising work experience required. 
- Writing experience in several forms of media required.

Computer Skills
- MS Office, Internet software, E-mail and Macintosh software.

Benefits
Square one has many benefits for our most important assets, our people! We offer Yoga classes to help with relaxation and cooperation.

Health and Wellness
Square one believes that if we make things people like, then they will like you back. We are relentlessly focused on engagement and interaction with our team.

Square one benefits outlined below cover the employee, spouse or domestic partner, and eligible children or dependents.

Medical 
As an employee, you have a choice between at least two medical insurance plans. Sq1 contributes a remarkable ~70% of employee premiums and ~55% of dependent premiums.
The summary below highlights our rich suit of employee benefits and a whole bunch of unique and useful perks. 

Vision 
As an employee, you automatically receive basic vision coverage for yourself, paid for entirely by Sq1 Your dependents (spouse, and/or child/children) can be covered for an additional charge. 

Dental 
Dental coverage for you is paid for entirely by Sq1 is available to your dependents for a minimal cost. 

Life Insurance and Disability 
You automatically receive a group life insurance policy, short and long term disability and accidental death and dismemberment insurance. These policies are provided at no cost to you.

Should you need additional life or disability coverage, both plans are available on a voluntary, supplemental basis. 

Retirement 
Square one retirement plan is part of the 4 A’s. Managed funds by advertising professionals.

English Language Editor (1st 12 months in China) We are seeking a recent college grad or perhaps an experienced marketing communications professional interested in spending the next 12 months on an exciting and rewarding assignment in China with one of the global leaders in the telecom industry.

This is a new position requiring a one year commitment to work from the headquarters offices of Wireless Product Line branding.  Following a brief period of assimilation/trial at the NA HQ located in Plano, TX, the selected candidate will travel to Shenzhen, China for 12 months. Successful performance could lead to department development, promotion and longer-term employment potential.

Job Objectives:
- Work closely with the HQ-based product line branding team to generate English language versions of key customer-facing material including brochures, web pages, presentations, and other collateral as required.
- Study lead competitive and Tier One customer materials.  Study and observe corporate mandates and templates.
- Recommend improvements to existing Huawei WPL material based on best industry practices.
- Assist in collection of required input, sequencing and presentation of communications material to meet Western standards.
- Correct and check content of final Chinese/English translations for review and approval by Chief Branding Officer (CBO).
- Compile an English language style guide based on guidelines to be provided by NA Tec Editors and CBO.
- Report to the Communications Director (assistant to the CBO) in Shenzhen HQ office and via dotted-line reporting to the CBO (globally).
- Work with the HQ Communications Director to maintain an accurate Project Status Report, detailing all deadlines and persons responsible for Input, Drafts, Designs, Approvals, and Production.
- Proof, check and correct amendments to all scheduled documents for accuracy and for factual, grammatical, and style consistency.
- Ensure the overall quality and accuracy of all final customer-facing material.
- Work with the Shenzhen HQ branding team to improve knowledge of English language (written and spoken) specifically related to enhanced appreciation of leading Western marketing expectations and standards.
 
Requirements:
- Able to complete a 12 month assignment in Shenzhen, China
- A Bachelor Degree or above in English, Communications, or related discipline.
- Previous proofreading and editing experience, preferably with marketing communications.
- Knowledge of telecommunication technology a plus.

Job Description:
Immediate opening for a Sales Account Executive with industry experience in selling creative and production services for large format printing, trade show graphics & structures, corporate branding & marketing materials, website design, POP displays and retail store décor. You sell, our team delivers!

Skills:
Prospecting, lead generation and new business development; project management; client liaison; customer service

Compensation:
Base + Commission

Company Description:
Ideas flourish here. It’s a concept that is vital to our business, and it defines our creative philosophy.

This is a place where talents merge and concepts unite, where individual ideas gain strength through collaboration. We’re an award-winning design firm with a talented team combining four distinct services — Design | Print | Web | Exhibit — to promote business growth. Our people are visionaries. We see the potential in every project, and we work together to achieve outstanding results. We are smart communicators, artistic designers, educated programmers, and experienced printers — and we’re all motivated by a passion for perfection.
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: If you are a self-starter, are customer driven, thrive in a fast-paced environment and want to be part of a dynamic team, send your qualifications to lou@bwc.net or fax to 972-699-3805. Visit our websites to see what we are all about: http://www.bwccreative.com and http://www.museumscapes.net

node_revisions_body:
We are looking for a creative web designer who is an out of box thinker, can create clean and innovative designs and wants to work on very high visibility projects. This is a contract position.
 
Designer will be working on the website of a large telecommunications company with product offerings in Wireless , Cable, Home phone and Internet services. Will get to be part of the entire product cycle from design ,implementation, launch and maintenance.
 
Sample work load:
1. Mockups for wireless products, cable, self-service , and other pages on the website
2. Micro site designs for important wireless product launches (latest and coolest phones)
3. Story board concepts for wireless phones guided tours. Work with action script developers, 3D modelers, animators and motion graphics artist to make your designs come to life
4. Concepts for in store advertising
 
We expect the following:
Attention to detail
Expect frequent peer reviews
Must have excellent oral and written communications skills
Should follow directions and be willing to help other members of the team as required
Must be able to juggle between different priorities
Portfolio of previous work
Long hours during crunch week

Required software skills:
Photoshop
Illustrator
Flash (Timeline and little action script)

The Director of Production is responsible for ensuring the production department is working to create the best catalog and website through layouts, photography, content and images. Wisteria’s production department is responsible for the photography, design, layout, content, and image work for all channels which includes but is not limited to the catalog, ecommerce and retail. A strong project manager is necessary for success in this position. This position must be a creative thinker in solving problems and achieving the end goal. This position will be responsible for managing up to 10 concurrent projects at a time. Position reports directly to the Vice President of Production.   
 
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
- Manage entire catalog Creative team including Production Manager, Content Manager, Image Manager, and Graphic Designer/Layout Artist.
- Manage Production Calendar.
- Ensure all dates within the Production calendar are met.
- Manage the production of each catalog from concept, design, layout, photography, content, imagery, pre press and production.
- Manage and oversee Production budgets.
- Ensure all Marketing initiatives are communicated and achieved.
- Ensure any Marketing developments are branded correctly throughout all venues.
- Maintain a professional atmosphere.
- Excellent communication with the Director of Production, Senior Creative Director, Art Director, and the Production Department.
- Proofread upcoming catalogs.
- This is full time position that may include working more than 40 hours a week


Critical skills include:
- 5 or more years of experience as a director within a creative services department for print media.
- 5 or more years experience managing a staff.
- 5 or more years experience and a high level of proficiency in project management.
- Extensive knowledge in creating and maintaining a production calendar.
- Extensive knowledge in creating and following a production budget.
- Knowledge of Adobe Indesign, Photoshop and Illustrator.
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Strong organizational skills, with attention to detail and dates.
- Ability to be flexible within the limitations of the production process.
- Experienced user of all Microsoft applications such as Excel, Outlook, and Word.
- Ability to think creatively and juggle many tasks and personalities at once.
- Strategic and independent thinking, planning, and follow-up skills.
- Understanding of both Mac and PC platforms.
- Self-motivated and decisive.
- Detail oriented with creative problem solving skills.
- Ability to execute under accelerated timeframes.
- Ability to quickly adapt to change in priorities.

Wisteria, a growing and dynamic multi-channel merchant of antiques and decorative items for the home and garden is searching for an energetic, professional, and dedicated person for the position of Director of Marketing for catalog, e-commerce, and all other retail channels. The successful candidate will possess strong organizational skills and be a creative problem solver. The Director of Marketing is responsible for the strategy, tactics and programs to create interest, demand and recognition for Wisteria that will translate into sales. This position will be the “hub” for the cohesive planning and execution of promotions for all revenue channels including catalog, e-mail, e-commerce and store or retail channels.  This position is also responsible for planning, organizing, and managing all marketing promotions, campaigns, traditional PR, events, and sponsorship opportunities while ensuring a consistent message and maintaining the Wisteria brand. In addition, the Director of Marketing is responsible for maintaing the budget and increasing revenues and profits. Marketing is an integral part of the company and requires working closely with all departments. A strong, organized, “big picture thinker” is necessary to help communicate initiatives, projects, and concepts throughout the organization. Position reports directly to the Vice President of Production.  
 
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
- Creating annual and quarterly strategic and tactical marketing plans.
- Responsible for competitive analysis and strategy.
- Assess the effectiveness of the marketing department and implement improvements.
- Manage and train existing and new marketing staff.
- Ensure timely and effective execution of the marketing tactics and programs.
- Create and maintain marketing budgets.
- Generate a monthly summary report and comprehensive quarterly and annual marketing reports.
- Work to create the media schedule, negotiate the rates, prepare the deliverables and execute.  Follow-up and measure all campaigns through all channels.
- Work with IT to increase Wisteria’s e-commerce presence by increasing conversion rates and assisting in making wisteria.com a destination to buy,  teach and entertain customers.
- Responsible for traditional marketing, PR, and all marketing aspects as it relates to ecommerce, email, catalog and retail channels.
- Work with the Production department to ensure a consistent look and voice among all channels.
- Disseminate information throughout the company internally as well throughout all media outlets externally.
- Manage weekly company newsletter.
- Maintaining a professional atmosphere.
- Excellent communication with all Vice Presidents and Directors as well as all members of the company.
- This is a full time position that may include working more than 40 hours a week
 
Critical skills include:
- 5 or more years experience as upper level Marketing Director.
- 5 or more years experience managing a staff.
- 5 or more years experience and a high level of proficiency in project management.
- Extensive knowledge in creating and maintaining a marketing plan and calendar.
- Extensive knowledge in creating and following a marketing budget and revenue budget.
- Extensive knowledge in statistics and analysis of all marketing channels and promotions.
- Extensive knowledge in creative and conceptual problem-solving.
- Extensive knowledge of public relations, advertising, direct marketing, and event marketing.
- Extensive knowledge in channel marketing, product marketing, presentation, sales and strong training skills.
- Extensive knowledge of ecommerce and web best practices.
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Qualified candidates will also have strong organizational skills, be able to work effectively under deadlines and manage concurrent projects
- Experienced user of all Microsoft applications such as Excel, Outlook, Word.
- Ability to think creatively and juggle many tasks and personalities at once.
- Understanding of both Mac and PC platforms.
- Self-motivated and decisive.
- Detail oriented with creative problem solving skills.
- Ability to execute under accelerated timeframes.
- Ability to quickly adapt to change in priorities.

Sally Beauty Holdings (NYSE: SBH) is the world’s largest wholesale and retail distributor of beauty supplies.  Our world headquarters is conveniently located just 5 minutes north of Lake Lewisville off of I35E.  We currently have an opening for a Graphics Editor.
 
This position is to conceptualize, layout/design, and produce an assortment of printed and on-line concepts developed and produced by the marketing communications creative services team. Play an integral part of the design process making suggestions and recommendations.  Create new processes for designers and artists.  This individual must have an understanding of the retail environment.  Our ideal candidate will have a Bachelor's Degree or related Graphics Art Degree
 
Primary Duties:
Design and produce store marketing promotions, education and show collateral including posters, shelf talkers, direct mail pieces, promotional brochures, shirt designs and tickets
Design and production of special projects for other departments, which includes preparing files for printer, trouble shooting, and building mock-ups
Create new processes for the other designers and artists to make them more efficient.
Share marketing/design layout knowledge
Assist in on-line up dates for websites
Act as a mentor to the other designers and artists
 
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Bachelor’s degree or related graphic arts degree
5+ years in graphic design experience
Retail sign/environment experience a plus
Proficient and strong hands-on working knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite including Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, InDesign, -MAC environment
Experience in Adobe Acrobat/ Distiller, Adobe GoLive and Macromedia Flash preferred
Ability to multi-task with accuracy
 Must be able to work under pressure and meet deadlines
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: Please forward your resume and salary history to: humanresources@sallybeauty.com.

node_revisions_body: Art Director for Upscale Western Lifestyle Magazine: Cowboys & Indians, an upscale, national Western lifestyle magazine, is seeking an experienced Art Director for its Dallas-based editorial department. This position will be responsible for the conceptualization of all editorial content, including photography acquisition and editing, and feature page design and production. Successful candidates will have extensive publication design experience. Expert-level proficiency with the Adobe Creative Suite and OSX platform is required. Dependability, attention to detail, strong work ethics and a positive attitude are all considered to be vital to employment.
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: For consideration, forward your resume and work samples (preferably in .pdf format) to jseale@cowboysindians.com. Qualified applicants will be contacted. No phone calls

node_revisions_body:
Wisteria, a growing and dynamic catalog of antiques and decorative items for the home and garden is searching for an energetic, professional, and dedicated person to become our Graphic Designer/Layout Artist for the catalog and e-commerce. The successful candidate will possess strong organizational skills and be a creative problem solver. The Graphic Designer/Layout Artist will work in conjunction with the Production team in achieving a uniform look and feel of the brand throughout all channels. This individual is responsible for carrying out the vision of the Brand Management Team in the layout of all images for print and web. Position reports directly to the Brand and Copy Manager.  
 
 
Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
- Own the layout, design content, imaging, and the design and look of all Marketing initiatives through print and web. 
- Own significant design and production responsibilities for sections of the website and new projects under the direction of the Brand Manager.
- Design for a multitude of projects in different phases concurrently.
- Work with the Production team to develop the brand, themes, merchandise focus and marketing focus which in turn creates engaging, consistent and organized catalog and website. 
- Work in the Production Design meetings to create the graphics and the layouts within the catalog and website.
- Detail oriented direction of all facets of catalog design including layout, pagination and flow, ensuring the highest level of efficiency and quality.
- Work collaboratively with multidisciplinary teams to create professional and engaging visual designs for website interface and online communications.
- Execute the design implementation of projects incorporating copy, innovative visual design and brand assets, while being mindful of usability and Web best practices and budget constraints of a print catalog.
- Maintaining a professional atmosphere.
- Excellent communication with the VP of Production, Brand Manager, and the Production Department.
- Proofreading upcoming catalogs.
- This is a full time position that may include working more than 40 hours a week
 
Critical skills include:
- 5 or more years experience in catalog layout and graphic design work.
- 5 or more years experience and a high level of proficiency in Adobe Indesign and Photoshop.
- Experience in creative and conceptual problem-solving
- Excellent visual design skills necessary and outstanding design portfolio of interactive projects required
- Exhibit stylistic breadth, consistency, attention to detail balanced with beauty, innovation and usability
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Qualified candidates will also have strong organizational skills, be able to work effectively under deadlines and manage concurrent projects
- Experienced user of all Microsoft applications such as Excel, Outlook, Word.
- Ability to think creatively and juggle many tasks and personalities at once.
- Understanding of both Mac and PC platforms.
- Self-motivated and decisive.
- Detail oriented with creative problem solving skills.
- Ability to execute under accelerated timeframes.
- Ability to quickly adapt to change in priorities.

Fast paced, creative agency seeks imaginative Art Director/Designer with 2-3 years agency experience. Able to concept and execute. If you are a self-starter, detail oriented, able to establish priorities, and are incredibly cool with a sense of humor we'd like you to send your portfolio and resume for review to eds@theonegrp.com.

Qualifications
- Bachelor’s Degree in Multimedia Design/Web Design
- Experience using HTML, CSS, XML, Flash & Flash ActionScript, Javascript, AJAX, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, and Final Cut Pro
- Excellent Photoshop skills – including retouching and masking photography in a timely manner
- Keen design sensibilities and technical expertise, coupled with an understanding of web usability (Can users find what they’re looking for?)
- In-depth understanding of information organization, functionality and security
- Strong collaboration skills (you will interact with directors, editors, designers and clients to develop products)
- Well-organized, flexible and detail-oriented
- Comfortable working under tight deadlines and on multiple projects

Character of Work
Hire will be someone who is familiar with website development, modification, and maintenance.  He/she will coordinate, direct, and integrate the church’s websites, online services, and web-based applications.

Job Duties
The Web Designer & Developer will…
- Identify and execute opportunities to develop video and audio content for the website
- Ensure all pages are being maintained and refreshed appropriately and assisting clients update content
- Confirm that websites adhere to online branding guidelines for the church
- Mentor team and clients on the use of digital media
- Monitor and analyze web traffic activity
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: If qualified and interested, please email your resume, salary requirements, applicable industry recognized certifications, links to sites showcasing your work in development, and links to sites that you have developed to Jacob Day, Director of Marketing, at jday@firstdallas.org. No phone calls

node_revisions_body:
Fast-paced, full scale marketing and advertising agency looking for a lead web developer. The applicant must be a problem solving, self-motivated individual, capable of working independently or in a team environment, on multiple projects at once and complete assigned tasks within a time-sensitive environment. Looking for a high-energy, self-motivated developer.
 
Development skills:

Someone with excellent html/css skills

Someone who programs in asp.net, up to and including version 3.5. or at least has a basic understanding.

Asp.net 3.5 is a broad framework, so here are the specifics of the framework that you must be familiar with:
ASP.NET masterpages
The C# programming language
JQuery javascript library, preferably with some experience with animation and using with asp.net AJAX.
Data tables for interacting with databases.
Basic database skills

Infrastructure skills:

Understanding of internet infrastructure so as to make website deployments.  (Domain name, DNS, hosting, etc.)
Networking skills.
Basic infrastructure skills (for setting up things like email addresses, servers, etc.)
Be able to maintain their own workstation and whatever other infrastructure is needed.

Other skills:

Must be self-managing.
Must be able to speak to non-technical people about technical topics.
Experience in estimating/scoping out projects.
Ability to speak in front of clients if needed.
Ability to think ahead in terms of strategy and plan as necessary.
Ability to manage others if necessary.
Agency experience a plus

JODesign has an immediate need for a talented and self-motivated Web Developer on a contract basis that wants to work with a progressive, rapidly growing Fort Worth design, marketing, and PR firm. Primary functions for this contract position are to conceptualize, design, program, test/debug, and launch new Web sites based on client requirements. Other functions would be to edit, update, and/or enhance already developed code, images, and content of existing clients’ Web sites on an as needed basis. The ideal contractor must have the ability to plan, lead, and manage multiple priority projects simultaneously from concept to completion while ensuring that budget, deadlines, Web development standards, and best practices are met; be aware and learn new Web development software based on industry trends; work with minimal to no supervision; and work outside of the JODesign offices but be available for frequent in-person meetings.

Contract applicants should possess a Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum of five years extensive experience with all matters of Web development to include online shopping carts and database creation, advanced working knowledge of HTML, Flash, Java, JavaScript, .NET, CSS, SQL, and XML. Macintosh experience preferred. Graphic design experience a bonus.
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: E-mail resume, cover letter, hourly rate requirement and digital portfolio to: Mary Ann Henker maryann@creativejo.com. Please reference “Web Developer” in the subject line. (Only resumes with hourly rate requirements will be considered.) - EOE

node_revisions_body: AvreaFoster is looking for a full-time copywriter who’s comfortable wearing many hats. Ideal candidates can adeptly juggle a variety of projects — from B2B collateral and promotional direct mail to branding and advertising assignments for a growing number of AvreaFoster clients. Applicants must have a minimum of three to five years’ experience — with B2B writing experience a plus and agency experience preferred.

Digital Marketing Director (Job ID# 1294)
SMU - Cox School of Business/ Marketing & Communications
 
The Digital Marketing Director is responsible for creating, executing, and measuring effectiveness of digital marketing and communication channels designed to achieve Cox School’s program objectives and bolster the school’s brand. This position will primarily use digital marketing tools including, the website, e-mail (including html e-mail provider), Blackbaud, and CRM database.
 
Primary duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
 
 - Managing the process by which the SMU Cox web site will be completely redesigned in aesthetics, architecture and content; maintaining and refreshing Cox Web site content for web pages owned by Marketing and Communications, including About Cox, Press and Media Room, and Collins Center;
 - Monitoring and analyzing web traffic activity to determine effectiveness of print and e-marketing, advertising, and PR activities;
 - Ensuring Web site adheres to online branding guidelines for the school;
 - Identifying and executing opportunities to develop video and audio content for the Web site;
 - Helping create and maintain online digital photo archive for school;
 - Ensuring that Web pages owned by other Cox programs/departments are being maintained and refreshed appropriately and assisting those customers in updating content;
 - Assisting alumni with online database/directory issues;
 - Serving as liaison to SMU Development in their development of alumni data management system;
 - Working with Marketing and Communications staff and program/department owners to develop, execute and measure digital marketing campaigns;
 - Mentoring team and peers on the use of digital media (CRM, social media, database, etc.);
 - Assisting with general administrative activities, including managing vendor invoices.


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 
Requirements:
A Bachelor’s degree is required, preferably in marketing, communications, advertising or multi-media. A minimum of seven years of work experience in integrated digital marketing, database marketing and/or Web site content development is required.
 
Candidates must demonstrate strong interpersonal, verbal and written communications skills with the ability to articulate complex ideas both in writing and verbally.
 
Candidates must demonstrate strong problem solving skills to effectively resolve problems and answer questions. Must also be a self starter with the ability to work in an independent role with minimal supervision.
 
Candidates must possess strong project-management and organizational skills to effectively set priorities and managing multiple projects simultaneously.  Must be deadline driven and results oriented.
 
Candidates must possess a strong understanding and familiarity with basic database structures. Must also possess strong knowledge of HTML and Web best practices. Experience evaluating the technical formats and aesthetic qualities of visual images for use across media is essential.
 
Candidates must possess as strong working knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook or Entourage, PowerPoint), Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, Acrobat). Experience with database applications such as Blackbaud and direct communications is essential. Experience with non-profit is highly desirable.
 
Candidates must possess a strong knowledge of Web servers and basic internet protocols (FTP,VPN). Strong knowledge in the principles of sound web usability, navigation and content issues is essential.
 
Candidates must possess experience in preparing and presenting complex online marketing tracking reports and solutions for optimization. Must also possess experience with online evaluation such as Google analytics, web trends and other online tracking reports. Experience evaluating various online advertising channels to achieve business objectives is strongly preferred.

Will produce on-target, on-budget  compelling creative for Fortune 500 clients. Including: Point of purchase materials, logos, packaging, trade show booths, sales support materials and pallet displays. Ability to express ideas through sketches a plus. Strong organizational, multitasking skills and working well under pressure required.

node_revisions_body:
General Description:
The Account Director is responsible for the management and operation of the entire account, including strategy, creative execution and results.  We’re looking for marketing leaders who have expertise in packaging, promotion and marketing communications through integrated channels.  We need experience and thought leadership in marketing consumer package goods at retail.  We’re looking for exceptional performers who have an entrepreneurial spirit and want to help contribute to and participate in the growth of a category leading creative agency.  This is a career opportunity.

Primary Responsibilities:
•    Be a creative/branding thought leader and articulate to our clients how to move a product or brand forward in the marketplace.
•    Lead strategy, development and delivery of consumer package solutions.
•    Work closely with Creative to assess client needs and service those needs beyond expectation, within the time frame and budget required.
•    Present creative ideas and solutions to Senior Client representatives, in a clear, thoughtful and compelling manner.  Develop and present new business and strategic initiatives.
•    Stay informed of industry trends and lead innovation within your group
•    Oversight of entire account effort, profitability, hiring, quality of work and ongoing client satisfaction.

Experience:
We’re looking for Acct. Directors with at least 15 years of practical experience in the brand building of consumer package goods.  An MBA is preferred as is experience with packaging and new product development.  That experience should be either in an agency or client brand environment.  We want pros who understand how to mentor the staff and lead by example, developing the younger talent to increasing responsibility.  We want someone who’s fun to be around, yet assertive, articulate and calm amidst the inevitable chaos.  You should have at least six direct reports.  An understanding of the Adobe Suite is essential.  We need a strategic, passionate, ambitious, articulate, entrepreneurial and charismatic leader who will drive results while growing and empowering subordinates.

Compensation:
Our client is offering a comprehensive compensation package including a base salary and outstanding benefits..  Your starting salary will be based on experience, expertise and is designed to intrigue premier candidates. The benefits package includes medical insurance (dental and vision), a 401K,  Disability and Life insurance.  An excellent re-location package is being offered.

About our client:
Our client is decades old, yet young, smart and innovative.  . . a uniquely positioned marketing resource that helps clients deliver at retail, across appropriate marketing channels.  Our client is proud of the loyalty of their own client base, which is leading to frequent, substantial new business opportunities.  The environment is new, high tech, modern, collegial and fun.  Our client is interested in loyal, productive and happy employees and works to retain them.

The client base includes global consumer package goods brands.

we can only respond to candidates of interest to our client.

node_revisions_body:
Dallas-based Branding/Design firm seeks highly creative Senior Graphic Designer for contract position.

Responsibilities & Requirements:
• Must work on-site
• Top-notch design and concepting skills a must
• Minimal 5+ years of experience as a senior designer within Ad Agency or Design Studio
• High level skills with InDesign, Photoshop, and Illustrator
• Create designs for print and websites (html programming knowledge not required)
• Knowledge of web design workflow is a big plus (i.e. wireframes, navigation logic, etc.)
• Strong collaboration, interpersonal skills, and able to take creative direction well
• Well-organized, flexible, detail-oriented, and passionate about design

Our press releases call us a top-five rated integrated marketing communications agency. Which is true. But sneak past the chatty PR department and you'll find HCK2 Partners is a pretty powerful little Drupal shop. We are already booked well into 2010, and boy do we need a Drupal developer or two in our pocket.
 
Here's the low-down on HCK2. We're in Addison. We are neither too big nor too small. We have six people on our interactive staff with a potential seventh if you fit. And with our team launching sites on average of one every couple weeks this year, are we ever busy.  We adopted Drupal on the cusp of 6 and have been incrementally making it our bitch ever since. You'll work with some brilliant, easy-to-talk-to guys who are ready for you to not only hit the ground running, but teach them some things.
 
You are comfortable working in the modular level of Drupal—you can at the least make small tweaks via module and at best pull off custom modules of your own. You have a solid comprehension of Views and Views templates. And you have a basic knowledge in using SVN and terminal to pull latest updates. The default Drupal markup is not good enough for you. And, even though they can be huffy little divas, you view designers as a required and valuable part of the UXD process.
 
Bonuses for us, but not required: performance geekery, standards and accessibility evangelist, JavaScript beast... and if you know what T.A.R.D.I.S. or BSG stands for, you're probably in by default.
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: Send your resume, a link to your portfolio and hourly rate to benji.smith@hck2.com.

node_revisions_body:
FUNimation® Entertainment, one of the nation's leading independent home video entertainment companies, is a full service brand management company with in-house production, marketing, public relations, licensing, internet, home video distribution and toy divisions. We are a growing company seeking an energetic and motivated full-time entry-level web designer/developer.  

The applicant must be a creative, self-motivated individual, capable of working independently or in a team environment, on multiple projects at once and complete assigned tasks within a time-sensitive environment. The ideal candidate for this position will be a high-energy, self-motivated graphic designer with the ability to turn rough ideas into their ideal website.

1. College/University degree preferred; 2 to 4 years trade school acceptable. 3+ years experience in design.

2. Strong sense of design and a high level of creativity are essential.

3. PC proficiency required; Mac proficiency a plus. Moderate knowledge of Flash, HTML, CSS, XML, Photoshop, and Dreamweaver required.

4. Asp.Net and eCommerce website knowledge is preferred.

5. Must have strong interpersonal skills in order to communicate effectively.

6. Portfolio of past and current work required.

node_revisions_body:
MultiView was just ranked by The Dallas Morning News as the fourth best place to work in D/FW. Right now, we need a talented and technically savvy Web Production Artist. This person will be our creative group's resident expert (John Hodgman anyone?) at combining beautiful design form with flawless web functionality. The position is 60% production, 40% creative.

You will: design and code display ads for a broad range of national and international companies; convert video files and optimize graphics for the web; be able to modify existing websites as well as conceive dynamic new ones; format graphics and text into elegant layouts for e-mail distribution.

To be qualified, you must have strong skills in Photoshop, HTML, Flash (Actionscript 2 and 3) and Javascript. We don't lean on Dreamweaver WYSIWYG around here--you need to be able to code HTML from scratch. A skills assessment exercise will be part of the interview.

You also need to have 1–3 years of professional experience and a degree that's relevant to the job.

Our work environment is fast-paced. What takes many creative shops weeks to do, we get done in a day. And quality? We think that improvisation is the test of talent. Every member of our creative group holds an honors degree in art and design. We know how to find inspiration and do great work without wasting time but we also have a wild sense of humor and genuinely enjoy working as part of a team.

node_revisions_body:
e3 Partners, the people behind the I am Second campaign, is offering a full-time or part-time graphic design internship. These are working internships in a casual, yet fast-paced environment allowing you to take real-world experience back to your college courses. Duties include working with senior creative and account services professionals, brainstorming, presenting concepts and production in print and new media. (Okay, there may be some organizing of the storage closet and counting of inventory too.) If you want to hone your skills and find out what your life might be like post-graduation,  this could be the opportunity for you.  If you are a recent graduate looking for an opportunity to polish your skills and gain experience, we would love to meet you as well.Working knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite is required, and interactive experience is a plus. We prefer interns who would be available for full days (approximately 9am-5pm) at least 2-3 days per week. A strong work ethic, a love of good design, and a Christian spiritual foundation is required. (Hey, we are a Church-planting missionary organization!)

We are a non-profit Christian ministry, so our internships are unpaid, but the rewards of working with an award-winning team of creatives will be a great start to a career in design. Plus, If you fit in well and have the right attitude, this position could lead to a paying position.
node_data_field_contact_info_field_conta: Still Interested? Sincere and well-prepared applicants may apply to kristin.deright@e3partners.org. Please include your resume and a pdf or link to samples your best work.

node_revisions_body:
The Marketing Communications Specialist works in the Marketing Department on projects for our National Brands & Agency Team including proposals, sales presentations, collateral and minor web management.  Additionally, the role will include working with the Vice President's of National Brands & Agency and Marketing to analyze needs, developing marketing campaigns to drive awareness and leads.

Responsibilities
- Develops new proposals, collateral and sales presentations including key product features, benefits, value propositions and competitive differentiators
- Updates existing presentations, collateral, web pages, marketing emails, and videos/flash to tailor them to the various customer audiences of the National Brands & Agency division
- Manages and updates microsites used to market products to franchise customers
- Works closely with Subject Matter Experts (SME's) on product marketing efforts relevant to the National Brand & Agency division
- Assists in the development of National Brands & Agency marketing communications and training for new product rollouts
- Researches and analyzes key customer segments to effectively develop marketing campaigns for awareness and lead generation

Ideal Candidate
- Effective communicator with excellent interpersonal skills
- Business minded creative who can learn the complexities of the National Brands & Agency division, and then create powerful and effective sales and marketing materials
- Working knowledge of the online advertising industry, including pay-per-click advertising on search engines, display advertising, and social media marketing
- Strong Project Manager who can handle multiple sales groups and their initiatives simultaneously

Technical Skills
- PowerPoint
- Photoshop
- Copy or technical writing
- Website manipulation
 
About ReachLocal
ReachLocal brings order to the fragmented local Internet by connecting advertisers, publishers and creative solutions providers together on one platform. Wherever customers are online, ReachLocal helps businesses find them with the broadest reach of local digital media, a dedicated force of local Internet marketing consultants, and proprietary technology that continually optimizes results.

Because of the Company’s wide reach and innovative technology, people are our most important commodity. Therefore, ReachLocal offers many exciting opportunities for forward-thinking people in Sales & Distribution, Accounting & Finance, Marketing, Business Development, Product and Technology. ReachLocal is headquartered in Woodland Hills, California, and operates with over 700 employees in more than 35 offices in the United States, Australia, Canada and the United Kingdom.

ReachLocal is an equal opportunity employer. Applicants for all job openings are welcome and will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or any other basis protected by state, federal or local law. It is the intent of the Company to comply with all applicable federal, state and local legislation concerning equal opportunity in employment.

Communication Design Senior Lecturer, Full-Time The University of North Texas College of Visual Arts and Design is seeking an exceptional educator and communication designer with strong conceptual and interpersonal skills. This individual must possess a balance of professional and teaching experience in identity design, publication design, three-dimensional / packaging design and industry-standard design technology (including but not limited to Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop and InDesign). The Senior Lecturer position will be under a three-year contract, maintaining a course load of four classes per semester term. The candidate will be expected to further energize and catalyze a critically rigorous, well-established program at the undergraduate level. Significant interaction with colleagues will occur on a regular basis. Student advising and university service are required. This position requires an M.F.A. or its equivalent in Communication Design or Graphic Design and three years of professional experience in the field of graphic design; or, a B.F.A degree and five years of professional experience in the field of graphic design. Candidates must have a minimum three years of full-time teaching in higher education as instructor of record in the aforementioned disciplines of identity design, publication design, and three-dimensional/packaging design with evidence of excellence as a teacher.

Staff Level: Professional
Staff FLSA: Exempt
Status: Part-time
Department: Communications

Qualifications
- 1–3 years experience
- Proficiency in Mac OS X and Adobe Creative Suite 4 (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator) and Acrobat, PDF creation and pre-flight on the Macintosh platform
- Ability to turnaround 2-3 weekly, full-color publications in time for proofing and printing • Utilize complex templates, style guides and libraries from design prototypes.
